availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Stephen Elliott (Hardin County, Kentucky, attorney and notary public)

body.p: Hardin County, Kentucky, attorney and notary public. New York native. Married to Martha Swan Elliott in Hardin County, Kentucky, on January 27, 1835. Father of Frances Elliott, Mary Elliott, Adell Elliott, and William Elliott. Married to Letitia Morrison Elliott in Hardin County on January 24, 1854. Father of Junius Elliott. Married to Mary A. Buford Elliott in Hardin County on March 17, 1857. Father of Kate Elliott. Printer in Hardin County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Hardin County in 1850. Attorney in Hardin County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Hardin County in 1860. Notary public in Hardin County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, Northern District, pp. 307A-B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, District 3, p. 96.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, Elizabethtown, p. 10.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hardin County, Elizabethtown, p. 325A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994037, Hardin County Marriages.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hardin County Marriages, Film 000390788.
KYR-0001-017-0266.
